meanings.definition: A plural noun meaning small, thin pieces of material used to pluck the strings of a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The musician used plectra to play the guitar at the concert.
meanings.sent2: I bought a set of plectra for my friend who plays the ukulele.
meanings.sent3: The plectra decided to form a band and start their own music group.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the strings as if guided by invisible plectra.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the plectra striking the guitar strings echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: A verb meaning to pluck or strum with a plectrum.
meanings.sent1: She plectraed the strings of the banjo with skill and precision.
meanings.sent2: They always plectra the guitar softly to create a soothing melody.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to plectra the yarn ball, thinking it was a musical instrument.
meanings.sent4: His fingers moved like lightning as he plectraed the strings of the mandolin.
meanings.sent5: The plectraing of the strings filled the room with beautiful music.
